pros: You're treated with respect, you're surrounded by some of the most brilliant and self-motivated people in your field, and the staff are all extremely friendly and helpful. Also the food is insanely good.

pros: The resources here are incredible, the environment is wonderful. It is almost too perfect. It is easy to get work done here.  It is not hard to see why some of the greatest minds of our time work(ed) here. There are many nice activities going on (besides academic ones) to keep you busy when you're not pondering by the pond.
cons: You can feel quite secluded, since there are no students walking around the campus and the Institute is located on a farm near the woods. This can take some getting used to. Health insurance is extremely expensive, but they are currently working to fix this.

pros: Good experience, worth doing as a first internship but overall not too much to learn
cons: Same routine daily gets old sometimes, very small department, coworkers overly anal sometimes, extremely little or no room for growth

review_title: The place is so nice and I like the afternoon tea every day.
pros: It has nice environment and nice people.Moreover the working place is so nice and there management and apartment condition are so excellent.
cons: Because the people are few in this city so if you are single, then you will feel a little alone living here.

pros: Good salary, and good food at the cafeteria
cons: the health insurance that was provided was truly speaking horrible. The premiums were too high and the subsidy was worse than Obamacare.

pros: Exposure to high-level research in a wide variety of fields. Excellent benefits package and generous paid time-off.
cons: Non-inclusive culture... many events catering to academics only.
